item.description:
The Munich Oktoberfest, the largest folk festival in the world, has its origin in the wedding ceremonies of crown prince Ludwig – later King Ludwig I of Bavaria – with Princess Therese of Sachsen-Hildburghausen in the year of 1810. In 2012, the Oktoberfest will be celebrated for the 179th time.

The festive setting for the opening of the Oktoberfest is the entry of the festival hosts and breweries. Octoberfest beers are brewed with festivals in mind, and Harpoon Oktoberfest does this. The Marzen style dates back to the days when refrigeration did not exist, making brewing in the summer impossible. The term Marzen refers to the month (March) when the last beer was brewed before summer. This beer would be lagered (stored) in ice caves until brewing resumed in the cool air of October. At this time, kegs of Marzen were tapped and enjoyed at harvest festivals.

It is the 23rd anniversary of Boston’s favorite Oktoberfest celebration. A wide selection of beer including IPA and UFO Hefeweizen, along with plenty of German food sold by a local guest restaurant; the best Chicken Dancing this side of the Alps; and the famous keg bowling game are all on the agenda. Three stages of music including New England’s premiere German Oompa-pa bands will be performing.

So come celebrate Oktoberfest out at Harpoon Brewery in Boston.

Harpoon Octoberfest Admission: Cover charge is $20.00 and includes a souvenir Pint Cup and one (1) drink ticket.

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: OKTOBERFEST 2012
